thread.title: Blue Jays blank Rays, Estrada outduels Archer
thread.title_full: Blue Jays blank Rays, Estrada outduels Archer | Toronto Star

author: Brendan Kennedy
title: Blue Jays blank Rays, Estrada outduels Archer
text:
Marco Estrada continued his season-long dominance of the Tampa Bay Rays Sunday afternoon, allowing just three hits over eight scoreless innings to lead the Blue Jays to a crisply played 4-0 victory in their rubber match against the division rivals.
In the kind of low-scoring game the Jays have had a tough time winning this season, Estrada outduelled Rays ace Chris Archer, who had conceded just a pair of singles before Jays outfielder Chris Colabello broke the scoreless tie with a two-run homer in the fifth inning. Jose Bautista tacked on a couple of insurance runs with a two-run blast of his own in the eighth.
It was all the offence Estrada would need as the 31-year-old stymied Rays hitters all afternoon, alternating between his high-80s fastball and baffling, Bugs Bunny changeup.
Aided by catcher Dioner Navarro, who threw out a pair of baserunners, Estrada faced just one batter above the minimum in his eight innings, at one point retiring 15 Rays in a row.
The last time Estrada faced the Rays — June 24 in Tampa — he took a no-hitter into the eighth inning and threw 8 2/3 shutout innings. (Coincidentally, it was Colabello who hit the game-winning blast then as well.) In fact, in two starts and two relief appearances against the Rays this season, Estrada hasn’t allowed a single run over a combined 21 innings.
Tasked to cover just one inning, the Jays bullpen was able to hold the lead with rookie right-hander Roberto Osuna pitching a scoreless ninth in front of a near-sellout crowd announced at 41,683.
The Jays have Monday off before a six-game road trip to Oakland and Seattle.
